channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging wisteria growth, 13th September
item.description:
The alleyway from Bramble Rise through to Whitethorne Drive has a lot of wisteria growth hanging over the wall and is taking over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Bramble Rise, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised footpath Prestbury High Street, 13th September
item.description:
The area of footpath not closed is covered in grass, weeds and overhanging branches. It is untidy and the weeds will undermine the wall unless treated. Wilding may be suitable for verges but they are unsightly snd a hazard on iconic raised pavements. Why not redeploy some of the Swindon Road Recycling team to deal with this issue rather than stand around watching others recycling!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 Morningside Close, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to curbing, 13th September
item.description:
The curbing has been damaged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Planets Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worsening potholes, 12th September
item.description:
As per pics

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Granville Street, Cheltenham

item.title: Open street sign furniture with wires exposed, 12th September
item.description:
There is a street sign with cables exposed on typhoon way in Gloucester on the houses just up from and opposite the bus stop

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 Typhoon Way, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road contains broken ground, 11th September
item.description:
Several pieces of damage to the road is causing my house to shake as they pass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Orchard Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement blocked by bushes, 11th September
item.description:
The path here is blocked by overgrown bushes, forcing a bloke in a wheelchair onto the road. Can the council either cut these back or request the owner does? We felt pretty bad for that guy having to deal with this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Manor View Cold Pool Lane, Up Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible Abandoned Vehicle, 10th September
item.description:
The location is the end of the woods on the Cleeve Common Road and opposite the Bill Smiley Butterfly Reserve. This vehicle is out of Road Fund Licence as at the 1st September. It is also in a damaged condition and the fear is it may be set fire to in an area that is still very dry. Please can it be removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed Manhole/Inspection Cover, 10th September
item.description:
On edge of path next to Glos College (Chelt). Needs Urgent attention (cordoned off).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface degenerating, 10th September
item.description:
Most of the road surface has come away on this section of Kingsley Gardens, this is national cycle Route 41 and it is important that it should be safe and not covered with gravel

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Kingsley Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsidence on the highway has left a dangerous search for cyclists, 10th September
item.description:
Where the road has fallen away on Kingsley Gardens there is a dangerous edge which could cause a cyclist to fall off. This is a national cycle route and Cheltenham should be able to do better.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Kingsley Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned plastic from the front of a car possibly from an accident, 10th September
item.description:
There is a big pile of abandoned plastic from the front of a car beside the A40 possibly because of an accident can somebody clean it up please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Kingsley Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Horizontal trenches across cyclepath, 10th September
item.description:
There are 11 Horizontal trenches across this short stretch of cyclepath that need levelling. Cycling here is unpleasant and jarring

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): St Thomas More Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bizarre traffic light signals, 9th September
item.description:
Traffic lights seem to go red as you travel along Cheltenham Rd towards Cheltenham, even though there's no cars or pedestrians on the side streets, before changing to green again, disrupting traffic flow and increasing pollution during quiet periods. Must be faulty sensors somewhere.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 256 Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin Overflowed, 9th September
item.description:
Bin has been overflowing all week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Leacey Court, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain in underpass, 9th September
item.description:
The drain at the underpass coming from Station Road, Churchdown is blocked and constantly floods. You cannot walk here when there is a lot of rain
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 important street lights not working on Cirencester Road, 9th September
item.description:
Two streetlights not working on Cirencester opposite grounds of St Edwards Senior school. They have been out for two weeks. It is very dark here and the road is used by ambulances every day and no street lighting is making it dangerous for speeding ambulances. Also the lights are close to 3 bungalows where very elderly people live. It would be very easy for burglaries to take place when it is so dark in the evening
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30cm deep sinkhole, 9th September
item.description:
Yet another sinkhole - the road needs deep investigation as this is happening repeatedly and the road is going to collapse!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5a Dunalley Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
